ygData.subject: New papers on evolving adaptive neural networks
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi all, We re happy to announce two new papers, which will be published at GECCO that try to address the challenge of evolving adaptive neural networks.

Subject: New papers on evolving adaptive neural networks
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=360532607; y=KQCjHIMyun0MRI91YZWvuUzAWTqtpeDW_AoG7yoJuQGrkidBXebmYEE
X-Yahoo-Profile: sebastian.risi
From: Sebastian Risi <sebastian.risi@...>

Hi all,

We're happy to announce two new papers, which will be published at=

GECCO that try to address the challenge of evolving adaptive neural
networ=
ks.

Evolving adaptive neural networks has remained challenging, mainly
bec=
ause of two reasons: (1) The networks have difficulties retaining
informati=
on over longer periods of time, and (2) evolving the ability
to adapt has p=
roven to be a rather deceptive problem.

In our paper "Accelerating the Evo=
lution of Cognitive Behaviors
Through Human-Computer Collaboration" by Math=
ias L=C3=B6we and myself, we
show that we can leverage human insights durin=
g the search for
cognitive behaviors because of our ability to more easily =
distinguish
between adaptive and non-adaptive solutions than novelty or fit=
ness-
based approaches. This paper shows that the recently introduced metho=
d
novelty-assisted interactive evolution (NA- IEC), which combines human
in=
tuition with novelty search, allows the evolution of cognitive
behaviors in=
 a T-Maze domain faster than fully-automated searches by
themselves.

Link =
to the PDF: http://sebastianrisi.com/wp-content/uploads/loewe_gecco16.pdf

=
In our second paper "Evolving Neural Turing Machines for Reward-based
Learn=
ing" by Rasmus Boll Greve, Emil Juul Jacobsen, and myself, we
extend our re=
cent work on evolving Neural Turing Machines to give ANNs
a more persistent=
 type of memory. We show that the Evolvable Neural
Turing Machine (ENTM) is=
 able to solve a simple copy tasks and for the
first time, the continuous v=
ersion of the double T-Maze, a complex
reinforcement-like learning problem.=
 In theT-Maze learning task the
agent uses the memory bank to display adapt=
ive behavior that normally
requires a plastic ANN, thereby suggesting a com=
plementary and
effective mechanism for adaptive behavior in NE.

Link to th=
e PDF: http://sebastianrisi.com/wp-content/uploads/greve_gecco16.pdf

Video=
 of an agent exploring the double T-Maze and ENTM source code:
http://sebas=
tianrisi.com/entm

Looking forward to your comments!

Best,
Sebastian

--
